column4: Hey all, is there something special you have to do to make programs play .mp3 files? I'm tried using JUK and Noatun, but neither of them are playing my MP3s
Not that I know of vidd
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RestrictedFormats#head-1340337f2ca1d0c54900935468515ba7630fcc59   specifically
I like that idea :-P
so try that. the howto hasn't been updated for Edgy yet, but installing gstreamer0.10-plugins-ugly should still work i think
thanks, I'll try it
of course, if you have Rythmbox open, you need to close it completely and restart it, for MP3 support to start working
see cge too
Where can I add/remove programs, I don't seem to have that option anymore
it should be under Applications -- though that's a stripped-down version. in System / Administration / Synaptic (I think) you'll have the full thing
but you can also just use "sudo apt-get install <packagename>" from a terminal
Yeah, that's what I'll use. I'm trying to convert my music to Vorbis
Is there a way to play MP3's without converting them?
Converting worked, just don't want to convert ALL my must to Vorbis
that wasn't what i was suggesting, at all. converting MP3 to Vorbis loses quality (though Vorbis itself is fine, it's just the conversion from MP3)
scroll *down* some more on that page, where it says " Install the package gstreamer0.10-plugins-ugly."
Okay
then just use your Rythmbox to listen to your MP3.
Well, let's give this one a try
My MP3's work now, but my .avi files and other things like that I can't view in my media player, any nice fixes for that?
others will be able to help you better, since i don't have any video codecs installed. the same page i gave you for MP3 has info about other formats, too -- read it
thanks
although not really a Server-specific question, you might try asking on #ubuntu-server, since that's a typical setup for the Server edition much more than the Desktop edition
